taskDescription:
Humans collectively exhale approximately <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>6.4235</mn>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>10</mn>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <mn>12</mn>
      </mrow>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">6.4235 \times {10^{12}}</annotation></semantics></math> pounds of carbon dioxide per year. There are approximately <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>7.647</mn>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>10</mn>
      <mn>9</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">7.647 \times {10^9}</annotation></semantics></math> humans currently living on Earth. How many pounds of carbon dioxide does a single human, on average, exhale per year?
detailedSolution:
A person exhales, on average, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>8.4</mn>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>10</mn>
      <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">8.4 \times {10^2}</annotation></semantics></math>, or 840 pounds of carbon dioxide per year.
